definition: to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-

sentences.english: A girl passed close to him, and Lieutenant Blandford started.
sentences.chinese: 一個女孩靠近他走過，布蘭佛德中尉喫驚地動了一下。

sentences.english: I think my inspection is just some sort of formality.
sentences.chinese: 我要告訴我的客戶，當不走過場起重重量。

sentences.english: He safely negotiated the slippery stepping-stones.
sentences.chinese: 他安全地走過了打滑的石階。

sentences.english: From then on, the sheep of this shepherd hadn't been thieved by the wolf any more.
sentences.chinese: 從此，那個牧民的羊就再也沒有被家狼叼走過了。

sentences.english: I'm convinced the new method won't work but I'll still have to go through the motions .
sentences.chinese: 我深信這個新方法起不了什麼作用，但仍還得走過場。

sentences.english: We may just be following Mother Nature's ancient recipe.
sentences.chinese: 我們可能正走在大自然曾走過的老路，步其後塵。

sentences.english: In the distance wild dogs barked, and a flock of ducks passed over.
sentences.chinese: 遠處幾隻野狗在叫，一羣鴨子蹣跚走過。

sentences.english: Why did the blonde tip-toe past the medicine cabinet?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼美女踮着腳尖走過藥品箱？
每年都有35萬名遊客走過這裏。

sentences.english: How many roads must a man walk down, Before you can call him a man.
sentences.chinese: 一個男人要走過多少條路，你纔可以稱他爲男人。

sentences.english: She did laugh as she saw Heathcliff pass the window.
sentences.chinese: 當她看見希刺克厲夫走過窗前時，她真的笑了。

sentences.english: In the counties I visited, the magistrates had to consult the peasant associations on everything in advance.
sentences.chinese: 我走過的幾縣，知事遇事要先問農民協會。

sentences.english: Could the Olmec heads depict African visitors from across the Atlantic?
sentences.chinese: 歐梅克頭像是描述成功走過大西洋而來的非洲人嗎？

sentences.english: I walk through the park on a sunny summer's day.
sentences.chinese: 我正正在一個陽勒奼蹦夜走過了母園。

sentences.english: Long-stemmed models ankled though the lobby.
sentences.chinese: 身材修長的模特兒嫋嫋婷婷地走過大廳。

sentences.english: The students walked through the gate with Uncle Li.
sentences.chinese: 學生們和李大叔走過大門。

definition: (in the) past/former/previous/to go over/to pass by
once/already/former/previously/ever/(past tense marker used before verb or clause)
variant of 這裡|这里[zhe4 li3]
to come over/to manage/to handle/to be able to take care of
only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
